page.title: 11LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: On the local moor there are{bronze age hut circles. The fields near the moor are small and irregular shape,probably meaning they were built in{prehistoric}times. Some farms are called{"bartons"}(e.g. Gnatham Barton),meaning they had stone buildings very early on. Fields away from the moor are more modern, large and regular shaped. { St.Mary's}church in Walkhampton is mostly five hundred years old. The oldest buildings in Walkhampton are 18th-19th{miner's}cottages,there were copper mines in the Walkham valley. A disused{railway line}(Yelverton - Princetown)is now used by walkers.It was closed in 1956.
